wikipedia_page.main: George Matthew Ede (born 22 February 1834 in Itchen, Southampton; died 13 March 1870 at Sefton, Liverpool) was an English cricketer and a Grand National winning jockey.

response: * George Ede (1834–1870), cricketer, captain, Hampshire CCC & Grand National winner 1868

In 1861 James Southerton, the Surrey cricketer was engaged at Southampton and resided at the Antelope Ground. He remained there until 1867. The first recorded individual century made on the ground was in 1862, when George Ede hit 122 for South Hampshire v East Hampshire.

Ede's father Edward Ede Sr. represented Hampshire between 1864 and 1870 and played in the county club's first first-class match in 1864. Ede's uncle, George Ede also represented Hampshire from 1864 to 1869. George Ede was the county club's first captain and like his brother played in the county club's first first-class fixture.
Edward and his twin brother, George Ede were both educated at Abingdon School, from 1845-1851. Ede made his first-class debut for Hampshire in 1861 against the Marylebone Cricket Club.

link_mentions.page: List of Hampshire County Cricket Club first-class players
response: The club's first match was played in 1864 against Sussex at the Antelope Ground. Led by George Ede, Hampshire lost by 10 wickets. Over the next 21 years, Hampshire played 74 first-class matches, although with little success. Following years of difficult circumstances and poor results to 1885, Hampshire is not rated a first-class team between 1886 and 1894.
*George Ede, cricketer, was born in Itchen
